comment: DO NOT TAKE HER, ON OWL EXPRESS HER LAST NAME ORCE BTW IF YOU CAN'T FIND HER UNDER RAQUEL SOTOMAYOR. VERY HARSH GRADERAND THEN WHEN I EMAILED HER ABOUT IT, SHE WOULDNT EVEN EXPLAIN FR WHY SHE GRADED MY DICCUSIONS THE WAY SHE DID.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The course content is rich, and the diversity of assignments is inspirational. I enjoyed the semester. She is innovative and a kind professor.
I liked her teaching style. She combines art, anthropology, and historical events. It gives you a new perspective.

professor is terrible, had to drop her class the second week of class starting because she continued to give me 60% on my assignments with no explanation and didn't answer the questions i asked whenever i emailed her. very passive aggressive and her grading scale doesn't make no sense. TAKE A DIFFERENT professor cause no.

For the same reasons others have given, do not take this professor. She was not helpful this entire semester and choses to be petty over grading. In my case, the professor gave me a "B" for a 89.65 and doesn't specify in the course syllabus that decimal grades are not rounded.
genuinely bad she is the single most harsh bum teacher who grades as hard as she can. If there is a chance you could fail she will find it.

This professor said her rubric is "conceptual" the definition literally being made up in your head, she grades based on how she feels that day. The instructions for assignments were extremely long, lacked clarity, and did not include many of her expectations that were pertinent in the grades she gave. Wouldn't take this class if there is ANY others
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I enjoy her philosophy of history. Everything is interconnected, and I admire her insightful philosophy of history. She masterfully demonstrates how everything is interconnected, providing a clear and compelling explanation of the geopolitical connections, historical context, and their far-reaching consequences.

-12 essay type of assignments 
-weekly quizzes (2 tries)
-midterm & final (2 tries, but second attempt is set of new questions)
-a lot of work for a required elective course
-very strict on grading
I have learned a lot in class and invested much time in it. I also like to read, and I hope you will do the same. Overall, she is a teacher I recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is a teacher who answers in less than 24 hours and thoroughly clarifies all the questions I have presented. However, she requires good content and does not accept superficiality. If you want to learn and research, she is the right teacher.

This professor has issues with grading in general. I tried so hard in this class and it was for nothing. Assignments are extremely lengthy and challenging to find topics for. I sent countless emails to this professor and she never helped me ONCE. I would complete assignments and they would never receive grades. Choose your professors wisely.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Do not take this class this is an honest review from a 4.0 student  Each module has a  100-120 individual sentences this is 1500- 2000 words for a detailed response on how someone's work inspired you and A essay assignment that gave the most unclear instructions and her lectures 20-30 min per video  and you cant understand a word she says. Awful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Do NOT take this professor. you cannot understand anything she says and she grades the discussion posts ridiculously hard with terrible explanation. "Enrich Your content" is all she says with no explaining how to. Only good part is attendence isn't graded. But DONT take this teacher if you want an easy A or B. And the tests are hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I truly valued her classes. The teacher consistently delivered grades on time and promptly addressed all my emails. Although the assignments require significant commitment and careful attention, the effort pays off immensely. I gained invaluable insights that will benefit me greatly.

I was disappointed by the comments I read, but it was the class that best suited my schedule. I am happy I chose her. Her classes are exceptional, and her explanatory effort is immense. I recommend her.

She has an accent which was hard for me to understand sometimes, but her passion for what she taught really made up for it. She have more homework than my online classes combined, but if you don't like your grade you can make it up later. Midterm and Final were super hard for me and dragged down my grade significantly, but I truly love this prof.

Easily the most difficult history class I have ever taken. Only two tests, most questions are "select all that apply", meaning one missed option and its graded incorrect. Lectures are long and often boring, but necessary to pass the class as there are no resources besides the text book and lecture slides that are useless without the notes.

This class is lecture-heavy, confusing, and lacks clarity in grading, especially for quizzes. It only has two tests(midterm and final) making it challenging to pass. The writing assignmens are a bit easy but sometimes she makes unclear suggestions. I would not reccomend this teacher at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This is the worst professor I have ever had by far. She is so bad at grading it's actually insane. She asks for so much on the homework and you can literally give you double the amount of effort and she will give you an 80 at the most. The only reason I will pass this class if from the online quizzes and exams. Like please don't take her seriously!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I am very interested in her classes and would recommend her for her passion in the lectures and rich content.

I read the comments before signing up for the class, but I chose this time because it was practical. However, I can say that I liked the concept of history because of her classes. She is undoubtedly a rigid but excellent teacher. If you want to learn, she is the ideal teacher.

This professor is by far the hardest grader I've ever had. The instructions are unclear on writing assignments, she will not explain the instructions further, office hours are not helpful, and it is extremely boring. Many times my assignments have been graded unfairly and when asking her about what I was doing wrong she was not helpful.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is by far the most difficult and frustrating teacher I have ever had. I am typically a straight A student, however I cannot seem to get above a C in this class. She will arbitrarily give you a grade, and then extremely unclear feedback, or simply repeat the directions. There are only two tests, the midterm and the final.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Actually insane. Never had a professor this bad in my life. She grades differentl every week like one week I may change up something w/ discussion posts and she'll give me a terrible grade I wouldn't have made the week before. If you do decide to take the class just know the midterm and final are the quiz questions from the semester so take photos

TERRIBLE. Like genuinely I dont know how this lady is even allowed to teach. Her grading system makes absolutely no sense and she's picky based on how she feels that week. She gave me 60 on having 2 similar replies to people, but a 75 when I didn't use an article when she literally DIDNT state to use that article. Her grading system is so messed up
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Terrible brain dead teacher. Will fight with you over your grade, for simple mistakes. Unclear instructions, untimely grading, excepts vast History knowledge for prereq class. Never explains your failing grades even when asked. Very avoidant by email. don't do it. take any teacher but her, like seriously
Very boring

She is the meanest, most poor quality professor I have ever had. I don't know how she's at KSU. She read my medical chart wrong. She falsely asserted that my doctor said my sickness was minimal because she could not be bothered to google what a PHQ-9 score is and ridiculed me for it.
Grades were not commiserate to my work.
Worst experience :

Each week, you had a quiz, virtual museum (curator and patron), discussions, and reflection journals. Each assignment was graded harshly; to get an A, you have to follow instructions exactly. Feedback didn't always make sense. Midterm and final are the only tests and questions were from quizzes. Access to quizzes was restricted after two attempts.
